name: Poco
description: Poco believes music can change people's lives. He's so enthusiastic about it that he never stops playing, even after people ask him to!

gadgets.name: Tuning Fork
gadgets.description: Poco and all nearby allies heal 592 health per second for 5 seconds.

gadgets.name: Protective Tunes
gadgets.description: Removes active adverse effects from friendly brawlers in a large area and gives a 2.0 second immunity.

starpowers.name: Da Capo!
starpowers.description: When Poco's attack hits friendly Brawlers they now heal for 962 health.

starpowers.name: Screeching Solo
starpowers.description: Poco's Super now also hits enemies, dealing 1520 damage.

tips: Poco is great at supporting allies due to his ability to heal them using his Super, his Tuning Fork Gadget, and his Da Capo! Star Power. Prioritize healing over damaging enemies with Poco because Poco's healing can help teammates win many battles and interactions by keeping them alive.

Remember, Poco's attack has a wide spread but doesn’t deal much damage. This means he’s not used as a front line attacker, but rather used for effective support. Positively, the spread allows him to hit multiple targets at once and charge his Super quickly. The wide spread of his attack also allows him to check large bushes.

When using Poco’s Da Capo! Star Power, try lining up his attacks so you can chain them to heal allies and damage enemies simultaneously, similar to how you use Byron’s Injection Star Power. This is the best way to get the most value out of Da Capo!, and grants your allies more survivability whilst chipping enemies.

Poco's attacks can be released in quick succession, allowing him to attack an enemy Brawler multiple times to charge his Super quickly before retreating to reload again, or heal a teammate quickly and effectively with his Da Capo! Star Power.

Poco's healing abilities are more useful than Pam's in tight situations when you or your teammates are on low health, as Pam's Super takes time, while Poco's Super is instant and occurs in a much larger area. This makes his healing considerably more useful than that of Pam in offense and survival-oriented modes like Bounty where teammates cannot afford to stay near Pam's turret for long.

Poco with other healers can be insane at healing. Poco could constantly heal Pam and/or Byron and vice versa to stay alive almost indefinitely, or in 3v3 events, two such healers can continuously heal a third teammate while they attack enemies and attempt to gain control of the map.

Poco is amazing when paired up with tanks as Poco can continuously replenish their health while they keep Poco safe from stronger Brawlers and control the map. Using Poco's Tuning Fork Gadget and Poco's Da Capo! Star Power will be more ideal in this case, since with them, Poco can heal allies even without his Super.

It is advised to use his Screeching Solo Star Power when playing Showdown, Lone Star, or Takedown due to the lack of teammates to heal with Da Capo!. This Star Power is especially effective if Poco has his Super charged while standing with multiple low-health enemies. However, Poco is never too viable in such Solo events as he lacks a sufficient damage output and a use for his support abilities.

Even though Poco is a support Brawler, his Screeching Solo Star Power gives him hybrid capabilities, as this Star Power allows Poco to deal damage to enemy Brawlers and heal himself at the same time. Even so, Poco's Super with Screeching Solo should not be used to deal damage in the same manner as his attack. It’s also necessary to note that Poco’s Screeching Solo damage is quite low, so if the Super’s desired motive is to deal damage, it’s best to use it to finish off low-health enemies instead of directly damaging enemies.

history.description: Poco's Super can now go through walls.
His main attack range was decreased by 15%.
Poco's main attack damage was decreased to 140 (from 160).
The number of hits necessary to charge Poco Super was decreased to 5 hits (from 6).
His Super no longer heals pets or spawnables.
Poco was slightly retextured.
Poco's rarity was changed to Super Rare (from Rare).
Poco's main attack damage was increased to 160 (from 140).
His Super healing was increased to 460 (from 400).
Poco's Swan Song Star Power was added.
Rapid attacks with Poco are now properly registered.
The health and damage statistics of all Brawlers were multiplied by 4.
Poco's first Star Power was renamed to Da Capo! (from Swan Song) and reworked from healing nearby allies for 1000 health when Poco is defeated to making Poco's main attack heal allies for 200 health.
Poco's reload time was decreased to 1.8 seconds (from 2).
His Da Capo! Star Power healing was increased to 300 (from 200).
Poco's health was increased to 3800 (from 3200).
Every Brawler's movement speed was increased by 70 points, increasing Poco's base movement speed to 720 (from 650).
All Brawlers' projectile speeds are increased by 9%.
Poco's Da Capo! Star Power healing was increased to 400 (from 300).
Poco's main attack damage was increased to 700 (from 640).
His rarity was changed to Rare (from Super Rare).
Poco's reload time was decreased to 1.6 seconds (from 1.8).
Poco's main attack range was increased to 7 tiles (from 6.33).
His main attack projectile speed was increased by 28%.
His Super projectile speed was increased by 92%.
Poco's main attack damage was decreased to 660 (from 700).
Poco's Da Capo! Star Power healing was increased to 500 (from 400).
Poco was remodeled.
The Serenade Poco skin was added. It was featured as a Brawlentine's Day skin.

Poco's flavor text was changed from "After losing his fans to a rival band, Poco fills every waking moment trying to find the perfect riff to win it all back." to "Poco fires damaging sound waves at enemies. His Super can heal both Poco himself and his teammates!"
Poco's Super's healing was increased to 2100 (from 1840).
Poco's Screeching Solo Star Power was added.
Poco's Screeching Solo Star Power damage was decreased to 1000 (from 1200).
Poco's Da Capo! Star Power healing was increased to 600 (from 500).
His Screeching Solo Star Power damage was decreased to 800 (from 1000).
Poco's Da Capo! Star Power healing was increased to 800 (from 600).
The Pirate Poco skin was added. It was featured as a Pirate Brawlidays skin.
Poco's class was changed to Support (from Healer).
Poco's health was increased to 4000 (from 3800).
Poco's Da Capo! Star Power healing was decreased to 700 (from 800).
Poco's Tuning Fork Gadget was added.
Poco's main attack damage was increased to 700 (from 660).
Poco's Tuning Fork Gadget healing was decreased to 400 (from 500) per second.
The Poco Starr skin was added. It is featured as a Brawl Pass Season 3 exclusive skin.
Poco's Protective Tunes Gadget was added.
Poco and all of his skins received facial animations.
The number of hits necessary to charge Poco's Super was decreased to 4 hits (from 5).
The number of hits necessary to charge Poco's Super was increased to 5 hits (from 4).
The Trash Poco skin was added. It was featured as a Bad Randoms skin.
Poco's Screeching Solo Star Power damage was increased to 1000 (from 800).
Poco's Protective Tunes Gadget immunity duration was increased to 2 seconds (from 1).
Poco's True Silver and True Gold skins were added.
Poco Starr's main attack and Super visual effects were reworked.
Poco's main attack damage was increased to 800 (from 700).
The Desperado Poco skin was added. It was featured as a Brawl Pass Season 14 exclusive skin.
Poco's main attack damage was decreased to 760 (from 800).
Desperado Poco's facial animations were slightly reworked.
Poco's health was decreased to 3700 (from 4000).
All Brawlers' health and damage were increased from 5% to 10% with each Power Level.
Poco's Tuning Fork Gadget healing was increased to 473 (from 400) and now scales with Power Levels.
Poco's Da Capo! Star Power healing was increased to 865 (from 700) and now scales with Power Levels.
His Screeching Solo Star Power damage was increased to 1368 (from 1000) and now scales with Power Levels.

Poco's flavor text was changed from "Poco fires damaging sound waves at enemies. His Super can heal both Poco himself and his teammates!" to "Poco believes music can change people's lives. He's so enthusiastic about it that he never stops playing, even after people ask him to!"
The CCTV Poco skin was added. It was featured as a Starr Park Origins skin.

attack.name: Power Chord
attack.description: Poco strums his guitarrón, sending forward bone-jarring sound waves. Enemies hit by the waves take damage.

super.name: Encore
super.description: Poco heals himself and all friends he can reach with his uplifting melody. Does not affect enemies.
